item.content: To display just the country name and population, replace the * with "name, population"

item.title: Question 1
item.content: Display the name and area from table "world."

item.title: Example 2
item.content: The query shows the population density (population/area) for each country where the area is over 5,000,000 km2.

item.title: Question 2
item.content: Show the per capita gdp (gdp/population) for each country where the area is less than 5,000,000 km2

item.title: Example 3
item.content: We use AND to ensure that two or more conditions hold true. The example shows the countries where the population is small and the gdp is high.

item.title: Question 3
item.content: Lets find the richest small countries. Show the name and region where the area is less then 2,000 km2 and the gdp is more than $5,000,000,000

item.title: Example 4
item.content: The keyword IN allows us to check if an item is in a list. The example shows the name and population for the countries 'Ireland', 'Iceland' and 'Denmark'

item.title: Question 4
item.content: Show the name and population for 'China', 'Vietnam', 'Japan'

item.title: Example 5
item.content: What are the countries beginning with 'D'? The word LIKE permits pattern matching. % is the wildcard. The examples shows countries beginning with 'D'.

item.title: Question 5a
item.content: Show only the name of each country that begins with 'S'.

item.title: Question 5b
item.content: Show the name and region of each country that begins with 'T' and ends with a 'n'.

item.title: Example 6
item.content: Which countries are not too small and not too big? BETWEEN allows range checking - note that it is inclusive.

item.title: Question 6A
item.content: Lets find all the small countries where the area is between 10,000 km2 and 50,000 km2. List the name and area.

item.title: Question 6B
item.content: List the country names and population where the population is between 35 million and 75 million. Display the population in millions please.
